nodes.text: A Speeder Bike Built for Two

"A Speeder Bike Built for Two" was a song which had been written and released into the the galaxy prior to, or during, the time in which the droid known as Master-Com was administrator of The Wheel space station. Associates who worked with Master-Com during his time as administrator claimed he could often be found whistling the song's tune.

"A Speeder Bike Built for Two" was first mentioned in the second entry of Viva Space Vegas! The History of the Marvelous Wheel, a pair of articles released on the StarWars.com blog in 2013 and written by Abel G. Peña and Rich Handley. The song's name is similar to "a bicycle built for two," which is the last line of the real-world song Daisy Bell.
